description: Detects changes to the PowerShell execution policy in order to bypass signing requirements for script execution
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
name: Potential PowerShell Execution Policy Tampering
query: ((winlog.event_data.TargetObject:(/.*\\[Ss][Hh][Ee][Ll][Ll][Ii][Dd][Ss]\\[Mm][Ii][Cc][Rr][Oo][Ss][Oo][Ff][Tt]\.[Pp][Oo][Ww][Ee][Rr][Ss][Hh][Ee][Ll][Ll]\\[Ee][Xx][Ee][Cc][Uu][Tt][Ii][Oo][Nn][Pp][Oo][Ll][Ii][Cc][Yy]/ OR /.*\\[Pp][Oo][Ll][Ii][Cc][Ii][Ee][Ss]\\[Mm][Ii][Cc][Rr][Oo][Ss][Oo][Ff][Tt]\\[Ww][Ii][Nn][Dd][Oo][Ww][Ss]\\[Pp][Oo][Ww][Ee][Rr][Ss][Hh][Ee][Ll][Ll]\\[Ee][Xx][Ee][Cc][Uu][Tt][Ii][Oo][Nn][Pp][Oo][Ll][Ii][Cc][Yy]/) AND winlog.event_data.Details:(*Bypass* OR *RemoteSigned* OR *Unrestricted*)) AND (NOT process.executable:(/.*\:\\[Ww][Ii][Nn][Dd][Oo][Ww][Ss]\\[Ss][Yy][Ss][Tt][Ee][Mm]32\\.*/ OR /.*\:\\[Ww][Ii][Nn][Dd][Oo][Ww][Ss]\\[Ss][Yy][Ss][Ww][Oo][Ww]64\\.*/)))
